conversation.en_sentence: How much money are we talking about?

conversation.ja_sentence: 大分大きな額ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's quite a lot of money.

conversation.ja_sentence: 工事が終了間近の工場を拝見できると良いのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it would be nice to see the factory closer to completion.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it would.

conversation.ja_sentence: 建設の予定と新しい工場を使って行う予定の製造プランを拝見させていただきたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: I will definitely need to see your plans for construction and also for the future manufacturing plans using the new building.

conversation.ja_sentence: 早めに建設の予定をいただくことは出来ますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you bring me up to speed on the manufacturing plans?

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、では古い工場はこれからどうするのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I see, what plans do you have for the old factory?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、ちなみに新しい工場で作る予定の商品の試作品を送っていただくことは可能ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I see, by the way can your team send me some prototypes of the new products you will be manufacturing at the new location?

conversation.ja_sentence: 早めに拝見させていただけると嬉しいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I would be very interested to see these as soon as possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらのA会社の資金提供の件ですが、興味があります。
conversation.en_sentence: Regarding financing for Company A, we may be interested in providing financing.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかし一度私のB会社にこの案件を持ち帰り、話し合う必要がありそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: However, I will need to speak with my colleagues at Company B before I can confirm anything.

conversation.ja_sentence: その間にこちらの件の詳細と条件をB会社に送っていただければ、私どもで確認いたします。
conversation.en_sentence: In the meantime, please send the details of your offer to Company B and we will take a look.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご連絡いただけるのを楽しみにしています。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much, I'm looking forward to hearing from you again.

conversation.ja_sentence: 新しい情報が入ったらまたご連絡ください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please keep me in the loop with any new information.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you also, cheers.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、山田珈琲の山田です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Yamada from Yamada Coffee.

conversation.ja_sentence: あー川田さん、お久しぶりです。
conversation.en_sentence: Ah, Kawada, it's been a while.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今大丈夫ですよ、どうしましたか？
conversation.en_sentence: I have time so what's going on?

conversation.ja_sentence: よく駅に設置してあるのを見かけます。
conversation.en_sentence: I often see it set out in train stations.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですか、楽しそうな企画ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that so, sounds like an interesting plan.

conversation.ja_sentence: こんな小さいお店なのにうちでいいんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you really want us as we are such a small cafe?

conversation.ja_sentence: それはそれは嬉しいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, that makes me really happy.

conversation.ja_sentence: 取材なんて初めてでどうしたらいいんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: We've never been featured in the media before, but is there anything I should do?

conversation.ja_sentence: それだったら私でも大丈夫そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, if that's the case, I think I can help you.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、喜んでお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'd love that.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええっと、ちょっとお待ちくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Just a moment, please.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週はお店が月曜日と火曜日が休みなのでそれ以外がいいです。
conversation.en_sentence: Next week, the shop is closed as usual on Monday and Tuesday, but anything else is fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週はちょっと私が旅行に出るので火曜日も休みにしました。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll be traveling next week, so I decided to take Tuesday off as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 木曜日は17時までなら大丈夫ですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Thursday works if it's before five o'clock.

conversation.ja_sentence: 15時ですね、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: All right, three o'clock.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何か前もって準備しておくことってありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything I should do to prepare?

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、準備しておきます。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it, I'll get it ready.

conversation.ja_sentence: マイセンのカップがあるのでそちらを使いましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: I have some Meissen porcelain cups, so let's use those.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: All right, absolutely.

conversation.ja_sentence: 工藤さん、社内サーバーのバックアップ当番の引継ぎをしたいんだけれど今時間あるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Kudo-san, I'd like to hand over the duty of backing up the company's internal servers to you, but is now a good time?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、30分くらいで終わる予定だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Hmm, it shouldn't take longer than 30 minutes.

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、急なお願いになってしまってすみません。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, I apologize for the sudden request.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ工藤さん、向こうのサーバーラックのところに来て。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay then, Kudo-san, come over to the server rack over there.

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、作業手順書があるから特に必要は無いかな。
conversation.en_sentence: No, there's a procedure manual, so you don't really need anything else.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、手順書に沿って作業をするところを実際に見てほしい。
conversation.en_sentence: Today, I'd just like you to observe the work actually being done, in line with the procedure manual.

conversation.ja_sentence: その途中、気になるところがあればメモしてくれるくらいでいいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think it'll be fine if you just take notes of anything that you think is important as we go along.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ実際に作業してみるから、作業手順書と見比べていてね。
conversation.en_sentence: Right, I will do the actual work, and you compare it with the procedure manual.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、ただ、基本的にはこの手順書に従って作業をすれば問題はないよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right, but, basically, if you just work following along with the procedure manual, it's easy.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、たまにここに書いてないようなエラーが出ることがある。
conversation.en_sentence: However, sometimes there will be an error that is not written in here.

conversation.ja_sentence: その時は、僕か菊池さんに確認してね。
conversation.en_sentence: When that happens, check with me or Kikuchi-san.

conversation.ja_sentence: 朝のバックアップの確認で30分と、夕方のテープ交換で15分くらいかかるかな。
conversation.en_sentence: It takes 30 minutes to check the backup in the morning and about 15 minutes to change the tapes in the evening.

conversation.ja_sentence: 慣れてくれば半分の時間で終われるようになると思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think you should be able to do it in half the time when you get used to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、昨年はこの部署に新人が入ってこなかったから二年間やっていたよ。
conversation.en_sentence: No, last year, we didn't have anyone new join the department, so I've been doing it for the past 2 years.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今年は工藤さんが入ってくれて助かったよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's such a help that you joined this year.

conversation.ja_sentence: サーバーのバックアップ当番の引継ぎは以上だね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, that's it for the handing over of the server backup duty.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何か質問はあるかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any questions?

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、ゴミ出しの当番と給湯室の掃除当番の引継ぎの時間はまたメールするね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will email you with the times for taking over the duties of cleaning the break room and taking out the trash.

conversation.ja_sentence: いや、まだまだ他にもあるから、またその時に連絡するよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, there are plenty of others as well, but I will contact you at that time.

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I am Gary Green.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ゲーリー・グリーンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: I'm from Lexington, Kentucky.
conversation.ja_sentence: ケンタッキーのレキシントンから来ました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Last week, I arrived in this country to take up my new position.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここで新しい仕事をするために先週この国へ到着しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: I previously worked in Chile, and Mexico.
conversation.ja_sentence: 以前はチリとメキシコで働いていました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: No, this is my first job here.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、これがカナダで初めての仕事です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but only on vacation.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、休暇のみですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: I've been here a handful of times.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何度か来たことがありますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: The first time, I visited, I went to Vancouver.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初の時はバンクーバーへ行きました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Then, once I went to Newfoundland.
conversation.ja_sentence: それ以外には、ニューファンドランドにも行きました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: I went there to see the whales, and puffins.
conversation.ja_sentence: クジラと角目鳥を見に行ったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: You have a beautiful country.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの国はとても美しいですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I played a major role in the marketing strategy of Product A in the U.S.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、アメリカでは製品Aのマーケティング戦略について主な役割を担っていました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: I haven't heard anything about Product Z.
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品Zに関しては何も聞いたことがありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Tell me about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 教えてもらえますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: What?
conversation.ja_sentence: え？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Why are we going to be selling dog collars?
conversation.ja_sentence: なんで犬の首輪を売ることになったんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'm a little nervous because I have never done any marketing for pet supplies.
conversation.ja_sentence: はあ、ペット用品のマーケティング経験は全くないのでちょっと不安です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: Most of my experience has been in marketing home goods and kitchen ware.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私のマーケティングの経験は家庭用品やキッチン用具がほとんどですから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ゲイリー グリーン
conversation.en_sentence: You're right, I will do my best!
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね、頑張ります！

conversation.en_sentence: Can I sync Product A with my email account?
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品Aはメールアカウントと同期できますか？

conversation.en_sentence: What else can it do?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に何ができるんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, so it's not only a customer relationship management tool, but it's also a social media platform?
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、顧客関係の管理ツールというだけではなくて、ソーシャルメディアプラットフォームでもあるということですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's good to know.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは大切ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't want any of our sensitive information to leak.
conversation.ja_sentence: 機密情報を漏洩させたくありませんから。

conversation.en_sentence: Altogether, there are 42 representatives.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全部で42人の担当者がいます。

conversation.en_sentence: 12 of them are out in the field, and the rest work here in the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのうちの12人は外回りに出ており、残りはここのオフィスで働いています。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes sir, give me all of the bells and whistles.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、全部まとめてください。

conversation.en_sentence: That's really expensive.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても高価ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you give me a discount?
conversation.ja_sentence: 割引はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: That seems like a fair price, but I can't afford all of that right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 妥当な価格だとは思いますが、今すぐ購入できる余裕はないですねえ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have any kind of payment plans?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か支払い方法はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: How does that work?
conversation.ja_sentence: それはどんなプランですか？

conversation.en_sentence: No there isn't.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、結構です。

conversation.en_sentence: However, it is worth noting that the 10,000 price does not include tax.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただし、10,000の価格は税込じゃないということに着目しないと。

conversation.en_sentence: How much is the tax?
conversation.ja_sentence: 税金はいくらかかりますか。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't have a calculator, can you figure out the total price for me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は今電卓を持っていないので、合計金額を出していただけますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I have always been pretty bad at math, I guess that's why I am in sales instead of engineering or programming.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、僕は算数が苦手なんですよ、まあそのせいでエンジニアとかプログラマーではなくて営業をやっているわけなんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: How long have you been selling Product A?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何年くらい製品Aを販売されているんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you all for coming today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日はお越し頂き、有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: My name is John Sharp, and I represent Company G.
conversation.ja_sentence: G会社代表のジョン・シャープと申します。

conversation.en_sentence: I am excited to introduce our newest cleaning product to you all today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日は我が社の新商品クリーナーの紹介ができ光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: Our company spent the last year and a half developing this product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社はこの商品開発に1年半を費やしました。

conversation.en_sentence: I am happy to announce that our newest product is the best on the market.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我々の新商品は業界一と言えるでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: There are hundreds of products that claim to be "the best cleaner" on the market.
conversation.ja_sentence: 業界一と謳っているクリーナーは何百品もありますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: So what makes our product different from others?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、我が社の商品がどう違うかお分かりでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Products from other companies might meet your expectation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんは、他社の商品に満足されているかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: But do you know what's in those products?
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、これらの商品の成分をご存知でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: A lot of them contain harsh, toxic chemicals.
conversation.ja_sentence: これらの多くには刺激の強い有毒成分が含まれています。

conversation.en_sentence: You unavoidably breath in those chemicals as you use those products.
conversation.ja_sentence: その様な商品を使う事で、有毒成分を吸い込んでしまう事は避けられません。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you also want to expose your growing children to those chemicals?
conversation.ja_sentence: また育ち盛りのお子さん達にその様な化学成分に触れて欲しいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's why we developed this product using only non-toxic, plant-based ingredients.
conversation.ja_sentence: その様な理由で我が社は無害で植物ベース成分を原料にこの商品を開発しました。

conversation.en_sentence: It is a multi-purpose cleaner, so you can use it anywhere.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多目的クリーナーなので、どこでも使う事ができます。

conversation.en_sentence: As a matter of fact, that is one of the common complaints from consumers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はそれ、よく聞く消費者の不満です。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why we put so much time and effort into improving the effectiveness of our new product.
conversation.ja_sentence: だからこそ我が社は多くの時間と労力を費やし、性能を高めました。

conversation.en_sentence: I am about to demonstrate how effective it is when used on different kinds of surfaces.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今からどれだけ高性能であるか、様々な表面を使ってお見せします。

conversation.en_sentence: I will be explaining every single ingredient in the cleaner as I demonstrate.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実演しながら、原料を一つずつ説明していきますね。

conversation.en_sentence: I guarantee you are about to experience the difference!
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の商品との違いがわかる事確実です！

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, do you have a moment?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっといいかな？

conversation.en_sentence: About that presentation...
conversation.ja_sentence: そのプレゼンテーションの事なんだけど・・・。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, Mr. Okada just decided we will not be doing this project anymore.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今さっき岡田社長がこのプロジェクトはもう実行しないと決めたんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I did not see this coming either.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もこれは予測してなかったよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I have no idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: さっぱりわからない。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you put your effort into this.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君がどれだけ労力を費やしたのかを知ってるんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: If it was up to me, we would definitely continue this project.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が決めれるものならば、絶対にこのプロジェクトを続けるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I feel you.
conversation.ja_sentence: その気持ちわかるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I remember what happened two months ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: 二か月前に起こったこと覚えてるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We basically worked our tails off for nothing that time.
conversation.ja_sentence: あの時は全力で働いたのが水の泡になった。

conversation.en_sentence: He is notorious for making last minute changes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、最後の最後でにプラン変更する事で知られてるから。

conversation.en_sentence: We are not the only ones who are affected by his selfishness.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼のワンマン振りの犠牲になっているのは私たちだけじゃないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's true.
conversation.ja_sentence: 気分転換になるだろうし。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, he never had to be a team player.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はチームプレーヤーになる必要がなかったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: He was given this company by his father.
conversation.ja_sentence: 父親から会社を引き継いだからね。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you are upset.
conversation.ja_sentence: イライラしてるみたいだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me take you out for a drink tonight.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今晩飲みに連れていくよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You can blow off some steam.
conversation.ja_sentence: 気分転換になるだろうし。

conversation.en_sentence: I am here for you anytime.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつでもいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Good morning team!
conversation.ja_sentence: チームの皆さんおはようございます！

conversation.en_sentence: I'm so delighted to see so many new faces here at Company A today!
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日はここA社に沢山の新入社員の方々をお迎えすることができて、大変嬉しく思っています。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm Dennis Brown, and the gentleman to my left is Bill Higgins, our CFO here at Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はデニス・ブラウン、そして左側にいるのは我が社のCFOビル・ヒギンズです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, everyone should take two forms of identification and their W4 forms to HR by the end of the day.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、全員2種類の身分証明書とW4フォームを持って今日中に人事部に行ってもらう必要があります。

conversation.en_sentence: There will be someone there all day today, so when you have everything filled out, you can just stop by and drop it off.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は人事部には1日中誰かがいますから、全部に記入し終わったら、寄って渡してください。

conversation.en_sentence: After we address compensation and benefits, we'll break for lunch.
conversation.ja_sentence: 給与と福利厚生についての説明の後に、ランチ休憩にします。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know what they ordered today Bill?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は何を頼んだのか知ってますか、ビル？

conversation.en_sentence: Nice, I can't wait!
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね、楽しみです。

conversation.en_sentence: Then after lunch, we'll pass out the company handbooks, and break out into groups for training.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、ランチの後は会社のハンドブックを配ります、それからグループに別れてトレーニングをします。

conversation.en_sentence: Bill, why don't you dive right into company policy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ビル、続いて会社のポリシーについて説明してくれますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely, Bill.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りだね、ビル。

conversation.en_sentence: Respect for our customers, for the opportunity, and for each other are foundational to our success, and are something we need to support every day.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様、与えられた機会、そして各々に敬意を払うということは成功への基盤であり、日々精進すべき事柄であります。

conversation.en_sentence: There is an Ethics & Compliance Helpline where employees can remain anonymous if they choose to.
conversation.ja_sentence: 匿名が良ければ、匿名で電話する事ができる倫理担当のヘルプラインがありますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Company A prohibits retaliation against any worker here at Company A who reports or participates in an investigation of a possible violation of our code, policies, or the law.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社では、A社の規範または法律に違反する疑いがある場合の調査において、報告した人物、またはそれに関わった人物に対しての報復を禁止しております。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing, Bill.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です、ビル。

conversation.en_sentence: Since all of you are starting on the ground level, your salary will be forty thousand dollars a year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん第1段階からのスタートになりますので、年棒は4万ドルになります。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, you up front with your hand up.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、最前列の手を挙げているあなた。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have a question?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かご質問ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Bill do you want to field this one?
conversation.ja_sentence: ビル、この質問に答えてもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to give all of you a rundown of today's agenda.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の議題を手短に説明したいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: First, we will be filling out all of our paperwork.
conversation.ja_sentence: はじめに、皆さんで書類に記入してもらいます。

conversation.en_sentence: After that, we'll go over company policies, compensation and benefits.
conversation.ja_sentence: その後は、会社の規範、給与そして福利厚生についてお話しします。

conversation.en_sentence: Dennis, will everyone need to meet with HR?
conversation.ja_sentence: デニス、皆さんに人事部に行ってもらう必要はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I think they got tacos.
conversation.ja_sentence: タコスだと思いましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing Dennis.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です、デニス。

conversation.en_sentence: The Company A Code of Conduct is one of the ways we put Company A's values into practice.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社の行動規範は、我が社の価値を実践するための１つの手段です。

conversation.en_sentence: It’s built around the recognition that everything we do in connection with our work at Company A will be, and should be, measured against the highest possible standards of ethical business conduct.
conversation.ja_sentence: その規範は、我々が業務に関することは全て、可能な限り最高水準の倫理的なビジネス行動基準に照らし合わせて行っていくべきである、という認識に基づいて作成されています。

conversation.en_sentence: Our commitment to the highest standards helps us hire great people, build great products, and attract loyal users.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最高水準を公約するということは、良い人材、良い製品、そして長期ユーザーの確保にもつながります。

conversation.en_sentence: If you have a question or concern, don’t just sit there.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし質問や気になる事があったら黙っていないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: You can contact your manager, your Human Resources representative, or Ethics & Compliance.
conversation.ja_sentence: マネージャー、人事担当者、倫理担当者に連絡してください。

conversation.en_sentence: Dennis what should we do if we have a concern of a suspected violation?
conversation.ja_sentence: デニス、もしも規範に違反している疑いがある場合どうしたらいいでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we take ethics very seriously here at Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです、このA社においては、倫理に対して大変真剣に取り組んでいます。

conversation.en_sentence: Another thing we know you take very seriously is money.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう１つ皆さんが真剣に考えている事はお金に関してですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Dennis, could you tell them about compensation?
conversation.ja_sentence: デニス、給与に関して話してもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Certainly.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Overtime will sometimes be available.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残業は時々あります。

conversation.en_sentence: It is always optional, and will be paid out at time and a half.
conversation.ja_sentence: 強制ではありませんし、1.5時間分支払われます。

conversation.en_sentence: That goes for anything over eighty hours in a two week period.
conversation.ja_sentence: 2週間のうち80時間を超えた分に対して適用されます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Bob, welcome back!
conversation.ja_sentence: おいボブ、おかえり！

conversation.en_sentence: How was your trip?
conversation.ja_sentence: 旅はどうだった？

conversation.en_sentence: I've never been to the Caribbean.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕はカリブ海は行った事ないんだよなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: I've never been on a cruise either.
conversation.ja_sentence: クルーズもしたことがないなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: Where all did you go?
conversation.ja_sentence: どことどこへ行ったの？

conversation.en_sentence: That's awesome!
conversation.ja_sentence: いいねえ！

conversation.en_sentence: Where did you go first?
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初はどこへ行ったの？

conversation.en_sentence: Where?
conversation.ja_sentence: それどこ？

conversation.en_sentence: I've never heard of that place.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞いた事ないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: So, is it the capital of two countries?
conversation.ja_sentence: 二つの国の首都なの？

conversation.en_sentence: Does that mean that it's part of England?
conversation.ja_sentence: それはイギリス領って事？

conversation.en_sentence: So which two weren't originally included?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの2つの州が違ったの？

conversation.en_sentence: What did you do there?
conversation.ja_sentence: そこで何をしたの？

conversation.en_sentence: Did you go to any other islands?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の島には行った？

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, you went to Jamaica?
conversation.ja_sentence: おお、ジャマイカに行ったの？

conversation.en_sentence: I would love to go there since I'm such a music fan.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は音楽が大好きだから行ってみたいんだよなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: How was it?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうだった？

conversation.en_sentence: That's so nice of you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 優しいじゃん。

conversation.en_sentence: I would love to go sometime.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕もいつか行ってみたいなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: Candace?
conversation.ja_sentence: キャンディス？

conversation.en_sentence: Hey, this is Jackie, you came and helped us open the store in Memphis last summer.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも、ジャッキーです、去年メンフィス店のオープニングのヘルプに来てくれましたよね。

conversation.en_sentence: It's going pretty good, but there have been a few issue.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結構うまくいっているんですが、ちょっと問題がありまして。

conversation.en_sentence: We've had a really high turnover rate with employees.
conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員の離職率がとても高いんです。

conversation.en_sentence: They just leave after a few weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: 数週間で辞めてしまうんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I was hoping to get some more management advice from you, Candace.
conversation.ja_sentence: キャンディス、あなたからもう少し管理上のアドバイスが欲しいなと思っていたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I took your advice about getting to know the employees.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、あなたのアドバイス通り従業員との付き合いを深めるようにしました。

conversation.en_sentence: I started hanging out with them, and we became really good friends.
conversation.ja_sentence: よく話すようになって、私たちは本当に良い友達になりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Then, some of them don't listen to me anymore because we were friends and I got upset.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、友達になったせいで私の言うことを聞かなくなった人達が何人かいて、私は腹を立てたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We got into an argument, and they just walked out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 議論になって、その人達はそのまま辞めてしまいました。

conversation.en_sentence: You're right, it has created a lot of trouble.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、そこが問題の種でしたね。

conversation.en_sentence: I think some of the employees left because I wasn't giving them enough attention.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が彼らに十分な注意を払っていなかったんで辞めてしまったんだと思うんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: But, I can't spend time with everyone everyday!
conversation.ja_sentence: そうはいっても毎日みんなと時間を過ごすことはできませんし！

conversation.en_sentence: I suppose I did, but I really didn't mean too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんでしょうね、でも本当にそんなつもりはなかったんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Also a lot of the employees I don't really know well are just wasting time on the clock.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、あまり付き合いのない従業員達の方は作業効率が悪いんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: What should I do?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたら良いと思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, you're so professional Candace.
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、あなたはとてもプロフェッショナルですね、キャンディス。

conversation.en_sentence: I just think of my job as hanging out at the store and selling clothes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 店にいて服を売るだけが自分の仕事だと思っていましたが。

conversation.en_sentence: You have really put a lot into perspective for me.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたのおかげで視野が広がりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi, I am calling to let you know you mislabeled one of your products.
conversation.ja_sentence: おたくの会社の商品ラベルに記載ミスがあるので電話をしています。

conversation.en_sentence: My child could have gone into anaphylaxis shock.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの子がアナフィラキシーショックを起こす所でしたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: This is reprehensible!
conversation.ja_sentence: とんでもない不届きです！

conversation.en_sentence: My name is Amanda Louis and I live in Mobile, Alabama.
conversation.ja_sentence: 名前はアマンダ ロイスでアラバマ州モービル在住です。

conversation.en_sentence: I purchased your product N at Store G in my town yesterday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日この街のGストアでおたくの商品Nを購入しました。

conversation.en_sentence: As you may know by now, my son is highly allergic to peanuts.
conversation.ja_sentence: もうお分かりかと思いますが、うちの息子は重症のピーナッツアレルギーがあります。

conversation.en_sentence: So I pay very close attention to ingredients when I introduce new food to him.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから、新しい食品を与える際は常に原材料を確認します。

conversation.en_sentence: Since it was our first time purchasing your product, I double checked the label to make sure it did not contain nuts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回おたくの商品を初めて買ったので、ナッツが含まれていないか二度確認しました。

conversation.en_sentence: I trusted your company with the package that says nut free.
conversation.ja_sentence: パッケージにナッツフリーと記載されてるので、信じていました。

conversation.en_sentence: But you mislabeled the product!
conversation.ja_sentence: でも商品のラベル記載間違いしていますよ！

conversation.en_sentence: I found two small pieces of peanuts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 小さなピーナツのかけらを二つ見つけました。

conversation.en_sentence: You are so lucky that I had found those before my son had a chance to eat them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 息子が食べてしまう前に発見できて幸いです。

conversation.en_sentence: I could have sued your company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 訴訟問題にもなりかねませんでしたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That is hard to believe.
conversation.ja_sentence: 信じがたいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I will send you pictures of what I found.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見つけた物の写真を送りますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: They are clearly pieces of peanuts.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明らかにピーナッツのかけらですから。

conversation.en_sentence: It's xxx-xxx-xxxx.
conversation.ja_sentence: xxx-xxx-xxxxです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's my cell phone number, so I should be able to answer anytime.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の携帯番号なので、いつでも出る事ができますので。

conversation.en_sentence: John just put in his two weeks notice.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンがあと二週間で辞めるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Here is his letter of resignation.
conversation.ja_sentence: これが彼の辞表。

conversation.en_sentence: No, he is starting his own business.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、自分で開業するらしいんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, I need you to put in an ad for his position.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、求人募集を掲載してもらいたいんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Newspaper A and B and job search engine websites L and M.
conversation.ja_sentence: AとB新聞と求人サーチエンジンLとM。

conversation.en_sentence: And don't forget to put it on our website as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、うちのホームページにも掲載するのを忘れないでね。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure to list detailed knowledge of public relations functions and marketing disciplines.
conversation.ja_sentence: 広報職務とマーケティングについて詳しい知識があるという事が必須だね。

conversation.en_sentence: Also knowledge of social media strategies and execution.
conversation.ja_sentence: それからソーシャルメディア戦略と遂行についての知識。

conversation.en_sentence: Minimum 5 years of experience in digital marketing is a must.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最低5年のデジタルマーケティングの経験も必要。

conversation.en_sentence: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communication or similar field is preferred.
conversation.ja_sentence: マーケティング、コミュニケーションもしくは似た分野の学士号も望ましいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, so experience in Graphic Design is also a plus.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、だからグラフィックデザインの経験もプラスだね。

conversation.en_sentence: Applicants should be creative, motivated, and team oriented.
conversation.ja_sentence: クリエイティブで、意欲的、そしてチームワークを重視できる応募者が必要だ。

conversation.en_sentence: We need someone who pays close attention to details.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんと詳細に目を向ける事ができる人が必要だね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am counting on you.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, the sooner the better since John is leaving in two weeks.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョンが2週間後に去るから、なるべく早い方がいいな。

conversation.en_sentence: But I want to take time to hire the perfect candidate.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも時間をかけて完璧な候補者を選びたい。

conversation.en_sentence: How about the end of this month?
conversation.ja_sentence: では今月末はどうかな？

conversation.en_sentence: It should give us sufficient time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 充分時間はあるはずだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Meanwhile we have Maria filling in John's position until it gets filled.
conversation.ja_sentence: 後任が決まるまではマリアにジョンの代わりを務めてもらおう。

conversation.en_sentence: Good afternoon, everyone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さまこんにちは。

conversation.en_sentence: My name is Suzuki Yuki.
conversation.ja_sentence: 鈴木 由紀と申します。

conversation.en_sentence: I am the marketing manager of Company L.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はL社のマーケティングマネージャーをしています。

conversation.en_sentence: Today I am here with my coworkers, Millie Craft and Takumi Okuda.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本日は同僚のミリー クラフト、奥田 巧と共に参りました。

conversation.en_sentence: We are here to talk about our company and our new product K.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の新商品についてお話をさせて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: First, I will introduce our company and its history and mission.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは私が我が社の歴史、企業方針についてお話させて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Then our sales representative, Millie Craft, will show you our newly developed product.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてセールス担当のミリー クラフトが新商品の紹介を致します。

conversation.en_sentence: She will be demonstrating how to use the product as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: また商品の使用方法の実演もします。

conversation.en_sentence: After that, our graphic designer, Takumi Okuda, will show you our eye-catching package design and advertising campaign.
conversation.ja_sentence: その後グラフィックデザイナーの奥田 巧が人目を引くパッケージのデザインと、宣伝活動について説明させて頂きます。

conversation.en_sentence: Please do not hesitate to ask any questions at the end.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご質問があれば、遠慮なく最後にお聞きください。

conversation.en_sentence: Our company L was established by Mr. Albert Lawrence in 1965.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社Lはアルバート・ローレンスにより1965年に設立されました。

conversation.en_sentence: It started out as a small pet store in a rural town in Ohio.
conversation.ja_sentence: オハイオ州の田舎町で小さなペットショップとして始まりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Lawrence developed our original product to improve the hygiene of dogs and cats in 1982.
conversation.ja_sentence: ローレンスは1982年に犬猫の衛生事情を改善するために我が社のオリジナル商品を開発しました。

conversation.en_sentence: It has been one of the top selling pet-care products in the States since then.
conversation.ja_sentence: 発売当初から国内で最も売れているペットケア商品の一つです。

conversation.en_sentence: We have expanded our business world wide.
conversation.ja_sentence: 販売を国外にも拡大しました。

conversation.en_sentence: And we have successfully developed 3 more products since the original one.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてオリジナル商品のほかにも３つ商品を増やしました。

conversation.en_sentence: This new product is our fourth.
conversation.ja_sentence: この新商品は四品目です。

conversation.en_sentence: Our mission is to provide affordable, quality hygiene products to beloved pets all over the world.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の方針は世界中のペットにお手軽で高性能の衛生用品をお届けする事です。

conversation.en_sentence: Now I will turn over to Ms. Millie Craft.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、ミリー クラフトに代わります。

conversation.en_sentence: I have a big decision to make.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大きな決断をしないといけなくて。

conversation.en_sentence: I am trying to decide if I should go to law school or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロースクールに行こうか迷っているの。

conversation.en_sentence: It's easier said than done.
conversation.ja_sentence: 口で言うほど簡単じゃないんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: First of all, I don't know if I will be able to afford the tuition.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは授業料が支払えるかわからなくて。

conversation.en_sentence: I would graduate from law school with a hefty amount of debt.
conversation.ja_sentence: 卒業しても高額の借金が残るでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Business law since I have some experience with it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経験もあるし、ビジネス法にしようと思っているの。

conversation.en_sentence: I have been helping Mr. Edward with some legal issues for the last few years.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここ何年かエドワードさんの法的問題のお手伝いもしてきたし。

conversation.en_sentence: I really enjoy learning about the business law.
conversation.ja_sentence: ビジネス法を学ぶのがすごく楽しいの。

conversation.en_sentence: I am also worried that I won't be able to make it through the school.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、ロースクールをちゃんと卒業できるか心配なの。

conversation.en_sentence: I will be working full time here during the day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昼間はこの会社のフルタイムの仕事があるでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: M university and K college both offer night classes.
conversation.ja_sentence: M大学とK大学は夜にクラスがあるの。

conversation.en_sentence: But I don't know if I have enough time and energy to attend the classes and study.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、学校に通ったり勉強する為の時間と労力があるか不安。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds very encouraging.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう言ってもらえると心強いな。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I actually just passed it last month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は先月受かったばかりなの。

conversation.en_sentence: I actually have my law school applications ready too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はロースクールの願書も用意してあるの。

conversation.en_sentence: I just wanted to make sure I am making the right decision.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ自分の決断が正しいのか確認したくて。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイスしてくれて有難う。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I am going to mail those applications today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日中に願書を送ってみるね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am blessed to have a friend like you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたみたいな友人がいて幸せだわ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: Carson, I have something you might be interested in.
conversation.ja_sentence: カーソン、君が興味を持ちそうな事があるんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: It's MBA tuition reimbursement program.
conversation.ja_sentence: MBA授業料返金プログラムだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: This is actually our first year to offer the program.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は今年初めてオファーするプログラムなんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: And I think you will be a great candidate for that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、君が良い候補者になると思ってね。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: So this program would be perfect for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあこのプログラムは君にぴったりだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: I already looked at the requirements.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう必要事項を読んだんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: And you passed everything on the list.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は全て該当しているよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: You have your Bachelor's degree in Business Administration.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営学の学士号を持っているよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: You have been working here for longer than two years.
conversation.ja_sentence: この会社で2年以上勤務している。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: And you are very industrious.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてとても勤勉だし。

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: You could take classes either online or in the traditional classroom setting.

conversation.en_sentence: There is one thing I haven't checked off.

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: I am glad to hear that.

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス

conversation.en_sentence: Which means you will have to come up with the tuition money first.

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: You seem very thrilled.

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: I am going to go grab the application for you.

conversation.ja_speaker: アダム ビリングス
conversation.en_sentence: I will be right back.

conversation.en_sentence: Can I vent a little?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと愚痴ってもいい？

conversation.ja_sentence: 1、２日位は綺麗になるんだけど、またすぐに散らかるの。

conversation.en_sentence: That's what I am confused about too.

conversation.en_sentence: But his mess keeps me from concentrating on my work for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、彼の散らかったデスクのせいで私は全然仕事に集中できないの。

conversation.en_sentence: I am afraid I will just snap at him one day.
conversation.ja_sentence: いつか彼に対してきつい事言ってしまうかもしれない。

conversation.en_sentence: But I do not want to embarrass or upset him.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも恥をかかせたり、怒らせたりしたくないんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I might take your advice.

conversation.en_sentence: I am not a confrontational person.

conversation.ja_sentence: そんな手紙を書くなんて気まずいの。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you guys for giving us the opportunity to present you this logistic study.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はロジスティクス研究についてのお話をする機会をいただき、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: As requested, I have put together a proposal on the logistic study in moving a large piece of machinery from Japan to the United States.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご要望通り、日本からアメリカへ大きな機械を輸送する場合のロジスティクス研究についての提案を作成してきました。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Your understanding is correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解の通りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Depending on the state, and even highways, there will be certain regulations you have to follow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 州によっては、高速でさえ守らないといけない特定の規制がありますから。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You will also have to submit a routing to the state and apply for a permit.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、州のほうにルートを提出して、許可を取得しなくてはいけません。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: This proposal I made will show you various routes we can take to keep the costs down.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が作ったこの提案で、コストを抑えることができる様々なルートをお見せします。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We could select routes that go through Oregon as their regulations aren't as strict.
conversation.ja_sentence: 規制が比較的緩いオレゴン州を通るルートを選ぶことができます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or we can barge the equipment as far inland as possible then move it by truck.
conversation.ja_sentence: または、出来る限りの内陸部まで機材をバージ輸送し、そこからトラック輸送することも出来ます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or if your equipment can be broken down to smaller parts, we can look at moving it by rail.
conversation.ja_sentence: ほかには、機材を小さな部品にばらして、電車輸送することも可能です。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you send me the actual dimension of the equipment?
conversation.ja_sentence: 機材の実寸を送ってくれますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like an engineering drawing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば設計図など。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: This would help us visualize what we are working with.
conversation.ja_sentence: それがあれば、具体的に何を扱うのかイメージできます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So before I explain this proposal in detail, I'd like you to know that conducting a logistic study and executing one is not cheap.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、この提案を詳細にわたって説明する前に、ロジスティクス研究を実施し実践するのは安くないことを知っておいていただきたく思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: A logistic study of this scale will cost around five hundred thousand dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: この規模のロジスティクス研究は、50万ドルほどになります。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: And the actual coordination and execution of moving the equipment will cost around one million dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、実際の機材輸送準備と施行は、約100万ドルになります。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can also help you find a manufacturing facility whom you can outsource to.
conversation.ja_sentence: 外注できる製造施設を見つけるお手伝いもできますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We deal with a lot of companies since we are in the logistic industry.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロジスティクス業界にいますから、多くの企業と取引しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エディー ウォンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Just let us know how we can help.
conversation.ja_sentence: お手伝いできることがあったら教えてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, go for it.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes that's right.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: We are in the same field like Company C or Company D.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I'm based out of our Seattle office.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、実はシアトルオフィスを拠点に働いているんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Or do you eventually have to go back to Japan?
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは、いつか日本に帰らないといけないのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I will eventually go back to Japan.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん

conversation.ja_sentence: 二年前にここに来ましたが、後三年はここにいると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: It's great.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: There are many good Japanese restaurants so I don't miss food back home.
conversation.ja_sentence: 沢山の良い日本食のレストランがあって、故郷の味を懐かしまずにすみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: So what does your company do?

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is that right?

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, we do.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: If there is a certain product you're interested in, we can definitely talk and see if we can help you find it.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, here's my business card.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I can send you our company presentation by email later this week.

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also send your company's presentation?
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社のプレゼンも送っていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: It was nice meeting you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ、お会いできて嬉しかったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi I'm Jason Geller.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、私は、ジェーソン ゲラーです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: How are you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here's my business card.
conversation.ja_sentence: これ、私の名刺です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So Mr. Nakajima, what does your company do?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、中島さんの会社はどのような事をなさっているのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, what kind of industries are you guys in?
conversation.ja_sentence: へえ、あなた方はどのような事業を行なっているんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはすごいですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So where are you based out of?
conversation.ja_sentence: それであなたはどこを拠点にしているのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: How long do you get to stay?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのくらい滞在する事になるんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: What does your office do?
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの支社では何をしているんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても興味深いですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, maybe I should explain what my company does.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、私の会社の事業についてもご説明すべきですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: We're an engineering company that helps startups commercialize their technology.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社はスタートアップ企業が技術を商業化するのを助ける技術設計会社です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: A lot of startups have great ideas but don't have the technical capability to actually bring their ideas to life.
conversation.ja_sentence: 沢山のスタートアップの会社はとても良いアイデアは持っていますが、実際にそのアイデアを実現するための技術的な能力を持っていません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: So they can outsource their engineering and manufacturing to us.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、彼らは弊社に技術設計と製造を外注することができます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, you never know right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、分からないものですよね！

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, same here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, it's a pleasure meeting you.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、お会いできて光栄でした。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェーソン ゲラーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hope you enjoy the rest of the trade show.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残りのトレードショーでの時間を、楽しんでくださいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So today's session will be on dealing with tough customers.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今日の集まりは難しいお客さんとの接し方についてです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think the most important thing in dealing with customers is to be on their side.
conversation.ja_sentence: 接客において一番大切なのは相手の側につくということだと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Or at least pretend to be on their side.
conversation.ja_sentence: または、せめて相手の側についている振りをするということです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I would go with something like, I completely understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私だったら「よく分かります」などと言いますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It doesn't sound strong yet it shows you are understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: それほど強い表現ではないですが、あなたが理解していることを示せます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's important to listen to what they have to say.
conversation.ja_sentence: 相手が言いたいことをじっくり聞くのが重要です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Be sure to stay calm.
conversation.ja_sentence: 落ち着きを保ってください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: And don't yell back.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして、怒鳴り返さないこと。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's the worst thing you can do.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一番やってはいけないことです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: If they do start yelling, you have to defuse the situation quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし相手が怒鳴り始めたら、早くその事態を収束させてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I would offer them alternatives and various options to solve the issue.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題解決のために、選択肢や異なるオプションを提示してもよいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, you shouldn't talk to them if you don't have anything to propose.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーっと、提案することが何もないときは相手と話すべきではないですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should be prepared.
conversation.ja_sentence: 準備して臨んでください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: In that case, just say you will have to double check with your manager or say that you are working on a solution.
conversation.ja_sentence: その場合は、自分の上司と相談する必要がある、または今解決策を探している、と伝えましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The key is to show that you are doing something for them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 相手のために何かやっているというのを示すことが大切です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We all eventually experience this so you should be mentally prepared.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰もがいずれ経験することなので、精神的に覚悟しておくべきだと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you guys have any questions?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か質問はないですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: よし。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let's get back to work now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、仕事に戻りましょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: So thank you very much for having me today.
conversation.ja_sentence: あの、今日はお呼び下さってありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: So I wanted to take this opportunity to explain the various types of rail cars used in various industries.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、この機会に色々な業界で使われている様々なタイプの鉄道車両についてお話したいんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: As a rail car lease company, I'd like to explain the different types before going into further discussions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 鉄道車両リース会社として、議論を進める前に異なるタイプについて説明したいんですよね。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: So let's get started then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では始めましょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: So there are various rail cars used to move various products.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず、異なる製品を運ぶのに異なる鉄道車両が使われています。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you know of any of them?
conversation.ja_sentence: その中でご存知のものはありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: Those are called open-top hopper cars.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは無蓋ホッパ車です。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: The hopper is referring to the unloading method at the bottom of the rail car.
conversation.ja_sentence: ホッパとは、鉄道車両の下部から貨物を下す方法のことです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: The bottom can open up and unload the product in the rail car.
conversation.ja_sentence: 下部が開いて、鉄道車両に積まれた製品を下すことが出来るんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.
conversation.ja_sentence: そういうことです。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes there are.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ありますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: Typically, products that shouldn't be exposed to the rain will use closed-top hopper cars.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一般的に、雨に濡れるとよくない製品には有蓋ホッパ車が使われます。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: For example grain.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば穀物です。

conversation.ja_speaker: マイク スチュアートさん
conversation.en_sentence: There are also different sizes of rail cars.
